text:
Despite Kenya Moore’s denial that she’s not been fired by Bravo, reports say she won’t appear on “The Real Housewives of Atlanta” next season.

Moore, who recently went on record to bash rumors of faking her pregnancy and an impending divorce, was not offered a letter to return to RHOA, according to a Wednesday, May 24 report from Straight from the A. The local gossip site reported the former Miss USA was not in attendance at a mandatory meeting for the ‘wives. When folks inquired about her absence, it was reportedly confirmed she won’t be in season 11.

Sources tell the website Moore may be relegated to being a friend of the show, however, Bravo won’t confirm the cast line up until later in the summer, according to AJC Radio & TV Talk.

Reportedly, just four cast members are scheduled to be back: NeNe Leakes, Kandi Burruss, Cynthia Bailey and Porsha Williams.

That Moore isn’t joining a new season shouldn’t come as a total shock. Head honchos at Bravo were none too pleased when the star eloped with Marc Daly and he refused to show up on the show until the second half of the season. Additionally, Moore was noticeably absent from the regularly scheduled trip overseas, which was in Spain this season.

Still, RHOA executive producer Andy Cohen told “The Breakfast Club” Friday that Moore had no issues getting along with the other ‘wives.

“Kenya is good with the group,” he said.

As Moore herself has yet to say anything else regarding rumors about her return, Twitter users have been chatting.

“Kenya Moore is finally off rhoa thank the lord, hallelujah.”

“Is @KenyaMoore really fired from #RHOA? Because if she is I ain’t watching no’mo!”
title: Kenya Moore Silent As Rumors of Her RHOA Firing Build
